natural problem:
Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\]
natural solution: We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
&= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
shows  "det (vector [1, x, y]) (vector [1, x + y, y]) (vector [1, x, x + y]) = x * y"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
shows  "det (vector [1, x, y]) (vector [1, x + y, y]) (vector [1, x, x + y]) = x * y"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the determinant of the matrix where the first row is [1, x, y], the second row is [1, x + y, y], and the third row is [1, x, x + y]. The final answer is $x * y$.

a_1.informal problem: Calculate the determinant of the 3x3 matrix where the first row is [1, x, y], the second row is [1, x + y, y], and the third row is [1, x, x + y]. The final answer is x*y.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "mat_det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else y else if i = 1 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y else 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y))) = x*y"
shows  "mat_det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else y else if i = 1 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y else 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y))) = x*y"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "mat_det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else y else if i = 1 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y else 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y))) = x*y"
shows  "mat_det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else y else if i = 1 then 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y else 
if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y))) = x*y"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem:
Find the determinant of the 3x3 matrix that is defined as follows: 

- The elements in the first row are 1, x, and y. 
- The elements in the second row are 1, x + y, and y. 
- The elements in the third row are 1, x, and x + y. 

The determinant of this matrix is given by the expression x*y. Confirm that this is the case.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem 
fixes x y :: real
shows  "det(matrix([[1, x, y], [1, x + y, y], [1, x, x + y]]) = x * y"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem 
fixes x y :: real
shows  "det(matrix([[1, x, y], [1, x + y, y], [1, x, x + y]]) = x * y"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Find the determinant of the 3x3 matrix where the first row is [1, x, y], the second row is [1, x + y, y], and the third row is [1, x, x + y]. The determinant is equal to x*y.

shows  "det (vector [1,1,1], vector [x, x + y, x], vector [y, y, x + y]) = x * y"
a_4.formal solution:

 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy

 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "let A = Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. if i = 0 then [1, x, y] else if i = 1 then [1, x+y, y] else [1, x, x+y]) in det A = x*y"
shows  "det A = x*y"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "let A = Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. if i = 0 then [1, x, y] else if i = 1 then [1, x+y, y] else [1, x, x+y]) in det A = x*y"
shows  "det A = x*y"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Given a 3x3 matrix A, where the first row is [1, x, y], the second row is [1, x+y, y] and the third row is [1, x, x+y], prove that the determinant of A is equal to x*y.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "let M = Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then 1 else if i = 1 then if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y else if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y)) in det M = x * y"
shows  "det M = x * y"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "let M = Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then 1 else if i = 1 then if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y else if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y)) in det M = x * y"
shows  "det M = x * y"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem:
Given a 3x3 matrix M where: 

- the first row is entirely filled with 1s,
- the second row is filled with 1 in the first column, x + y in the second column, and y in the third column,
- the third row is filled with 1 in the first column, x in the second column, and x + y in the third column,

find the determinant of the matrix M. The determinant is equal to the product of x and y.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else y
                                                           else if i = 1 then if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y
                                                           else if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y))) = x * y"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
shows  "det (Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> i. Matrix.vec 3 (\<lambda> j. if i = 0 then if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else y
                                                           else if i = 1 then if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x + y else y
                                                           else if j = 0 then 1 else if j = 1 then x else x + y))) = x * y"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem:
Calculate the determinant of a 3x3 matrix where the entries are defined as follows:
- The entries on the first row are 1, $x$, and $y$.
- The entries on the second row are 1, $x+y$, and $y$.
- The entries on the third row are 1, $x$, and $x+y$.
The final answer is $x * y$.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> y"
shows  "det (vector [1, x, y], vector [1, x + y, y], vector [1, x, x + y]) = x * y"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Evaluate
\[\begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix}.\] The final Answer is xy
 ### Proof
 We can expand the determinant as follows: \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x & y \\ 1 & x + y & y \\ 1 & x & x + y \end{vmatrix} &= \begin{vmatrix} x + y & y \\ x & x + y \end{vmatrix} - x \begin{vmatrix} 1 & y \\ 1 & x + y \end{vmatrix} + y \begin{vmatrix} 1 & x + y \\ 1 & x \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= ((x +  y)^2 - xy) - x((x + y) - y) + y(x - (x + y)) \\ &= \boxed{xy}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> y"
shows  "det (vector [1, x, y], vector [1, x + y, y], vector [1, x, x + y]) = x * y"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem:
Find the determinant of the following matrix: 

1, x, y
1, x + y, y
1, x, x + y

given that x and y are distinct real numbers. The final answer is the product of x and y.
